Reviews.Title: “Clean and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Heather D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister and were very pleased. Comfortable rooms with good bathrooms, excellent beds and generally good facilities. Breakfast was really nice. Perhaps a little far from central Madrid but would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pierre C
Reviews.Content: I stay there almost once a month when I go to Madrid for business. Great location. Rooms are nice. Only missing a pool! Defenitely recommend this hotel. Rates are good for a hotel in the city. Very convenient for a short stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean with maid service every day, bed was comfortable. There was a good variety of food at the buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Little modern hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: markrr71
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this very modern styled hotel. Very clean, pleasant, modern styling and decor. Room was slightly smaller than anticipated, the hotel has given equal spacing to the wetroom/toilet area. A nice touch in most modern hotels is a room coffee maker, unfortunately this wasn't the case but didn't detract too much from a pleasant stay. Reasonably priced room service. Located within 600 metres of the metro which is about 20 minutes journey into the heart of central Madrid. Overall a great little find, very quite room. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: vazaha1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Madrid's best barrio - Barrio Salamanca. 100 mts walking to underground station - Diego de Leon. Clean, good breakfast, nice people

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Nikki403
Reviews.Content: I was visiting friends in Madrid and chose this hotel as it is close to where they live. That being said, it is not in the center of the city and you do need to take a cab and/or the metro to get into the main tourist areas. Otherwise it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: burnsziela
Reviews.Content: Choosed this hotel beacuse I lived nearby for 5 years. It was refurbished one year ago and the decoration is very nice. It's located in the residencial part of Barrio Salamanca, just 10/15 minute walking distance to its famous shops. Metro station is just outside hotel's entrance and plenty of taxis running up and down Juan Bravo or Francisco Silvela streets. Rooms are ok, they offered to change us to a twin bed, as the only left with a king size was minimal. Free wifi. Got a good rate through booking.com so value for money it was worth it. Only negative point was the cleaning ladies vacuuming the corridors saturday very early, I think it was 8am, probably waking up everyone in my floor.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable breakfast staff need a lesson in good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bevanchez
Reviews.Content: I don't often need to write negative comments as I choose my hotels very carefully (mostly after reading tripadvisor reviews!) but I can honestly say I've never met such miserable and surly waiting staff as those in this hotel. It was a shame because the hotel is really good value for money when compared to other Madrid hotels of the same standard and the staff on the reception were fine - pleasant and helpful. Examples of the breakfast staff's attitude: even though I said a cheery 'Buenos dias' every morning on arrival, I got a mumbled almost grudging response. When we sat down we were made to feel like we were an inconvenience just for being there - no one asked us if we wanted tea or coffee - we had to ask for it, then when it was brought up it was plonked hard on the table. Bearing in mind we were a party of 6 and asked for tea for 6 people (in Spanish!), the male waiter brought 2 small flasks of tea which barely made 3 cupfulls. No milk was brought. Plus we often had to get up and go around the other spare tables to find enough cups and saucers, & cutlery, for our group! The staff were so grumpy that in the end we felt awkward asking for anything. All they seemed to do was clear up and replenish the self-serve food, they never seemed to pay any attention to the people that were in there, it was as if we were invisible! This somewhat spoit my impression of this hotel. That being said the quality and variety of the food on offer at breakfast was good. Waiting staff - please take some lessons in customer service. Bedrooms were a good size, storage space was limited but fine for a few days' trip. Standard of decor was good but if I am honest the colour of the furnishings - everything grey and black - made the rooms quite gloomy, almost depressing. We had 3 twin rooms on 3rd floor at the back of the hotel, overlooking the pool, and they were quite dark inside. We actually wrote beforehand asking for rooms with a lot of natural light, (as previous reviewers had said their rooms were dark and gloomy) - so maybe they are all like it! Bathrooms were modern with shower area, no bath. Walls are thin, you know when your neighbours are in the shower! and the wooden floors mean you can occasionally hear people walking around in heels, but not too bad on the whole. There is nothing much to do near the hotel - which was expected as its in a residential area, except there's a good bar, with friendly staff, on the corner opposite the hotel, with cheap drinks compared to the city centre bars. A fairly big supermarket is just around the corner from hotel in Calle Juan Bravo. The metro station Diego de Leon is a one-minute walk from hotel and has good connections to central Madrid (about 20 mins journey). The metro was very easy to use, efficient and safe, we returned back one night at 1:15am - plenty of people on the trains even at that time. Trains run regularly until 2am. Madrid centre around the Sol area was extremely crowded day and night, just as central London is. Lovely authentic (not typically touristy) bar just off the Plaza Mayor (go to the far corner of the plaza and down some concrete steps to get to the street called Calle Cuchilleros - the bar is called the Arco de Cuchilleros (tableo flamenco) and has flamenco dancers on stage at 10.30pm - you pay a supplement on your first drink to cover the cost of the dancers (first drink was 11euros) then susequent drinks are normal prices, but the dancers are top flamenco dancers and the dancing is as authentic and enjoyable as you will get, second only to what I have seen previously in Seville. Taxi from airport to hotel 30euros each way (40euros on Sundays). Would I recommend this hotel? For value for money, for a short trip, with good connections to the centre.....it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: foodie978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last May, this hotel is very modern, is really well located in the Salamanca area surrounded by shops and restaurants within walking distance. Wifi was really fast and free in the hotel and the rooms were very modern, clean, large bathroom and all in all really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay, Great location”
Reviews.Author: apoto
Reviews.Content: The service is great. Very nice guys working that hotel. The rooms are real small but thats how many hotels are in the central locations. Internet works Only on PC if you have a mac don't expect to get internet. I was thinking it was only in my room but 3 other guys that had stayed there with a mac told me the same thing... the crazy thing is that the hotel management does not seam to understand the problem. the best thing about the room is the bathroom nice and big shower. but from some reason the room gets dusty vary fast. if you leave something on the bed when you get back few hours later the thing is covered with dust. i think it is the fabric covering the windows. The location is what make the hotel great... it is a real great to eat and hang out... next to the metro and few minuets from any central location in the city.. if you stay in Madrid for 2-3 days with out a mac it will be a great place...

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-style hotel in fun neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: nange25
Reviews.Content: It is a boutique-style hotel, very modern in Salamanca-great for reastaurants and shopping and easy metro access to rest of the city. I found the room to be well-laid out , maybe small for US standards but fine with me,and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Room is dark when you pull velvet curtains and there is no clock so bring your own. Staff was very helpful in providing information about out of town trips. Breakfast was excellent, you can chose all-you-can-eat buffet for 10 Euros or take one plate with a pot of coffee for 5 Euros-great deal. Can't quite get used to the European way of doing showers-not fully enclosed.

Reviews.Title: “Style vs. substance”
Reviews.Author: ExpatSouthernSpain
Reviews.Content: This an uncompromisingly modern hotel. The rooms (in light-absorbing black and dark grey) are undoubtedly stylish, but so little light is provided that it feels like an experiment designed to give everyone the experience of being partially sighted - I had to use a torch to read the instructions for the safe. The bathroom (wet-room) looks great, but doesn't actually work (the water goes everywhere) and the 'uber-modern' basin doesn't have anywhere to put the soap. Oh well, 'style-over-substance'.again.This is a pity, because it's reasonably-priced, the location is good, the restaurant for diner and breakfast is above average, and there is secure parking for around 20 euros a night (reasonable by Madrid standards). More serious is the attitude of some staff - most notably at night in our experience. Other annoyances were: a WiFi that didn't seem to work in our room; 55 TV channels, none of which were in English; a mini-bar that contained nothing alcoholic (apparently a management decision . . . in case children use it!;, a bar that refuses to serve you after 11.30pm.; and poor sound insulation - notably in the corridors. I hope they attend to these niggles, because I'd rather like to use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody in the front desk!”
Reviews.Author: mlm12345
Reviews.Content: I expected a lot more from this 4 star hotel! When I arrived, it took about 5 minutes for someone to show up in the front desk! The bedroom is very comfortable, clean and tidy. Once, when we returned at night, we stopped at the restaurant/bar and wanted a cup of tea. Again, nobody showed up to serve us, or even to tell that it was closed, or something like that. It is a pity that the hotel, which is new, modern and comfortable, offers bad quality services.

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: vanta_8
Reviews.Content: My only complain is that the room was small and there was no fan in the bathroom so every time we had a bath we had to open the window otherwise we were feeling the bedroom a little wet.The location was good and the hotel was next to the metro station and near to restaurants and shops. Breakfast was ok and stauff was ok .But for me this is a 3 star hotel and not a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Putzen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a trade show and conducting other business in Madrid. My local contacts suggested staying here as it would be good value for the money and very very close to the Metro. The hotel is more like a 3.5 star. Other than a very good buffet breakfast, it didn't really have other dining options. I didn't really care about this because I was in Madrid and there was no way I was going to hang out in my hotel for the stay. I would say that the rooms were very spacious by European standards, and comparable to typical North American hotel rooms. P.S. Be very cautious of the taxi drivers in Madrid. They were out to screw me the whole trip! Other than that, Madrid was incredible and one of my favourite cities in the World!

Reviews.Title: “Ok.. nothing special but not a four star”
Reviews.Author: goddesshekate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last night [9th March 07] having arrived there quite late. I was quite reluctant to write a review about this hotel because it had no definitive faults as such, it was simply not a 4 star which is what it was advertised as being. It was a 3 star hotel at most and I say this having stayed at two other 4 star hotels within a 5 day period during this last week - [Puerto de Gredos and the Confortel Suites which definately were 4 stars]. The reception area was a little drab and in need of a bit of varnish but I wondered whether I was being a little petty given how very friendly and helpful the reception staff were. They provided me with a metro map to get around and even helped me with some directions [for the following day] and this was at 2am in the morning when I arrived there!! The room itself was quite small compared to the Confortel Suites I had stayed at a few nights before, and despite having all the little things that travellers like in hotels [mini bar, toiletry extras like free comb, toothbrush, loofer, razor, body milk, etc] there was something not quite classy about it. It was almost as if it had pretensions of appealing to the business traveller without quite attaining this. Little things were offputting like the wide and cumbersome heater on the wall opposite my bed which seemed to take up so much room given that the room was already quite small; the lack of choice on the tv which catered almost exclusively for Spanish people [it would have been nice if they provided at least an English speaking news channel like the other hotels I visted] and the wi-fi connection was disappointing as it was not free and for the couple of hours I was there I was not prepared to pay the amount that it would have cost. All in all the hotel was not horrific.. just not too luxurious. It felt like a downmarket version of a true 4 star hotel. Parodoxically, the hotel was placed in a reasonably posh area of Madrid [so I was told on a few occasions]. The redeeming factors were the staff and the hotel's proximity to the Metro station [about a 40 second walk away] and the fact that the hotel was really trying.The following morning when I went down to pay my mini bar bill [I consumed one orange juice] they told me not to worry about it which was nice of them! All in all stay here if you need a hotel for a night or two but really if you stayed much longer you'd fell claustrophobic.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Zenit Abeba
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Alcantara 63, 28006 Madrid, Spain
